TopicTitle: Secret Sound Easter Egg Thing! [Might be Chatterer]

Articles.Content:
I was trying to fulfil a a contract, and when I renamed my station I noticed something.

This might be part of chatterer, I'm not sure.

If you're in orbit of a body, and have the type set to something like Station, Ship, Lander, or Base, you will hear a deep, far-off rumbling. Retype your ship to a Probe or Debris, and it'll stop. I'm not sure what it means, but it's a neat feature!

(Sorry for JPEG. This has more artifacts than an Indiana Jones movie set in Warehouse 13)

Edited October 23, 2015 by waterlubber

Yup, this jpeg definitely mumbles something.

It was for illustrative purposes
Confused as to why you posted a screenshot for an audio thing.

Confused as to why you posted a screenshot for an audio thing.
It was for illustrative purposes

I really didn't need to, but it completes the post

I wouldn't call it an easter egg. That'd be more like a secret feature you have to do special things for in order to discover it.

This is just a regular chatterer feature. When you're on board of a manned craft (and debris, even with Kerbals on board, is not regarded as such by chatterer) you'll hear "station sounds". Just like you'll hear airlock sounds when starting/ending an EVA, and breathing sounds during an EVA. Think of air & fuel pumps, those kind of things. Definitely not an easter egg.

I'm glad you posted the picture though. It immediately was clear to me what sound you were talking about.

I'm glad you posted the picture though. It immediately was clear to me what sound you were talking about.

This is going to follow me for the rest of my life, like Nova's easter egg plan.

This is going to follow me for the rest of my life, like Nova's easter egg plan.

You're taking it like a champ though!
I think the Screenshot would have more accurately described a smell......
